title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.9 - Anchoring vessel elsewhere than on officially designated anchorage ground within waters of Port of New York; prohibition of pilots-fine or suspension
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.9 - Anchoring vessel elsewhere than on officially designated anchorage ground within waters of Port of New York; prohibition of pilots-fine or suspension

State Regulations

Pilots are prohibited, except in cases of emergency, from
anchoring a vessel within the waters of the Port of New York elsewhere than on
an officially designated anchorage ground. Any pilot who shall violate this
section shall be liable to a fine of $100 or suspension from duty, at the
discretion of the commissioners. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

56.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
